body: @santouits Sorry if my changed caused you problems. I don't follow what you are having trouble with. Can you please post a code example showing the problem like in the issue above?

It looks like once an InputProcessor returns true, InputMultiplier also returns early before calling processors.end()

https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/5268da38a22663c8bbf4aff71d29ed47011fb58f/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/InputMultiplexer.java#L87-L88
@NathanSweet i think you should put a try/finally block around all loops to ensure processors.end() is called before methods return in all cases.
finally block is always executed whenether an exception is thrown or not. that fixes the issue.
@PokeMMO Changing the delayed array to a [snapshot array](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/utils/SnapshotArray.java) will solve your case then?

> It looks like once an InputProcessor returns true, InputMultiplier also returns early before calling processors.end()

Ah, of course. Sorry about that!

@santouits Looks like it would.

@NathanSweet Is there any reason not to use SnapshotArray instead? It seems like it would be more feature complete and allow adding an InputProcessor to the front of the array without having to resort to postRunnable.
